primair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: God executes a three-stage cosmic work (Creation, Redemption, Consummation) to establish eternal rest for His people.

subject.identificatie: God (specifically in the persons of Father and Son)
tekstueel_bewijs: God came among us in Jesus Christ
He shall have delivered up the kingdom
rest from labor — cessation, completion of effort
bringing us back where we belonged
the end of sin, the end of sorrow

ontvanger.identificatie: The People of God / Every Sinner
tekstueel_bewijs: He shall save his people from their sins
gave back to the sons of men another Eden

helper.identificatie: Jesus Christ (as the worker of the second Sabbath) and the Word/Scripture
helper.rol_van_geest: External help (implied in the 'Sentinel of our souls')

tegenstander.identificatie: Sin, Death, Evil, and Human Pride/Skepticism
tekstueel_bewijs: the power of sin and death broken
hostile powers are arrayed against us
the last enemy that shall be destroyed is death
tegenstander.toelichting_ernst: The opponent is not merely bad habits but ontological forces: Sin, Death, and the 'Powers of Hell' that require a divine Subject to defeat.

secundair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: The human response of worship and Sabbath observance as a sign of societal health.
secundair_narratief_programma.subject: The Believer / Citizen
secundair_narratief_programma.toelichting_verhouding: The sermon begins with human ethics (Sabbath keeping) but quickly subordinates this to the primary program of God's work.

voorbeelden_god_subject: God will be all in all
voorbeelden_mens_subject: We go along with all of our little machines
we must pass under the cloud

voorbeelden: we need to worry about those who observe no day
I want to finish this job
we who love Jesus know how it must come out
the power of sin and death broken
He shall have put down all rule

modale_analyse.modale_interpretatie: The sermon focuses on God's 'Ability' (Pouvoir) to complete His work, rather than the hearer's 'Obligation' (Devoir).

semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.beweging_in_preek: Moves from the restlessness of society (~S1) to the finished work of Christ (S1), acknowledging the current struggle (~S2) before concluding in the final Sabbath (S1).
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.theologische_resolutie: Resolution is found in the 'Finished Work' (It is finished), which bridges the gap between human labor and divine rest.
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.ernst_van_s2: High; Death is treated as a formidable, 'last' enemy.

diagnostische_evaluatie.classificatie_toelichting: The sermon is overwhelmingly theocentric. God is the subject of almost all transformative actions. Human activity is presented as either futile pride or a grateful response to a completed divine reality.

indicatoren_moralisme.indicator: Initial focus on societal Sabbath keeping
indicatoren_moralisme.tekstueel_bewijs: The passing from our society of a generally accepted day of rest... is another sign in the weakening and decline.

indicatoren_genade.indicator: God as the sole agent of redemption
indicatoren_genade.tekstueel_bewijs: When he died with his pierced hand he seized the initiative.
At Calvary the word was 'It is finished.'

exemplarisme_check.beschrijving: Biblical figures (Mary, Simeon) are used as witnesses to Christ's identity rather than models for the hearer's behavior.
exemplarisme_check.alternatieve_lezing: The sermon already treats figures theocentrically.

identificatie_patroon.theologische_implicatie: Monergistic salvation; God does the work, man receives the rest.

narratieve_coherentie.coherentie_beschrijving: The three-Sabbath structure provides a tight narrative arc from protology to eschatology.
spanning_punten: The transition from the civic 'day of rest' at the start to the cosmic 'Sabbath' of God is a bit abrupt.

soteriologie.tekstueel_bewijs: the power of sin and death broken... he must reign, till he hath put all enemies under his feet.

pneumatologie.competentie_schenking: The Spirit is not explicitly mentioned, though divine 'influences' and 'sentinels' are noted.

hamartologie.ernst_diagnose: High; Sin is a power that 'no man can hinder' except Christ.

aanbevelingen.actantiele_audit_samenvatting: The sermon successfully maintains God as the Subject. The narrative engine is fueled by God's historical and future actions.

identificatie_herstel.problematische_identificatie: The introduction invites the hearer to identify as a 'worried citizen' or 'Sabbath-keeper'.
identificatie_herstel.voorgestelde_identificatie: Identify as the 'helpless colony' or 'sinning heart' that receives the work.
identificatie_herstel.strategie: Shorten the civic introduction to move faster to the 'helplessness' of New York/Boston as a metaphor for the human condition.

modale_balans.voorgestelde_balans: Maintain current balance; it is a strong grace sermon.
modale_balans.concrete_suggestie: Perhaps add a touch of 'Vouloir' (desire) in the response section.

tegenstander_intensivering.theologische_rationale: The sermon already treats the opponent with cosmic seriousness.

narratieve_hierarchie_herstel.voorgestelde_structuur: The hierarchy is correct: God's work (Soteriology) precedes and enables human rest (Ethics/Experience).

aanbevelingen.slotopmerking: This is a masterclass in theocentric preaching. By framing the sermon around 'God's Sabbaths' rather than 'Our Sabbath-keeping,' the preacher ensures that grace remains the engine of the narrative.

comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_retorische_analyse: A rhetorical analysis would focus on the 'silver bells' and 'blizzard' metaphors; Greimas shows these metaphors serve to establish God's Pouvoir (Power) over human helplessness.
comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_exegese: Exegesis would look at the Greek/Hebrew of the verses; Greimas shows how these verses are actantially linked to form a single 'Program of Redemption'.
comparatieve_analyse.unieke_inzichten_greimas: Greimas reveals that the 'snowstorm' anecdote isn't just a weather story, but a 'Subject-switch' where Man is demoted from Subject to helpless Receiver, and God is promoted to Conquering King.

appendices.notities: The sermon effectively uses the 'Battle of New Orleans' as a narrative device to explain the 'Already/Not Yet' tension of the Object (Rest).
